course_title: Variable Topics in Human Health: Health Innovation Delivery
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 22 / Seats Avail: 11Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: This course guides students through the process of planning the implementation and evaluation of a health innovation. Human-centered and collaborative innovation models guide development of a sustainable and ethical business plan. (This course is the required capstone for all seniors with a Health Innovation Concentration graduating in Spring 2024, Summer 2024, or Fall 2024)
course_description: Seminar or lecture in various topics on human health. May be repeated for credit (up to 9 hours) when topic varies.
sections: Class Nbr: 2605, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 10-11:15a, Instructor: R. Hall-Clifford, Status: Open
